Head of Marketing and Corporate Communication Job at GIG Mobility




        
    

        
        GIG Mobility (formerly God is Good Motors) was founded in 1998 by Edwin and Stella Ajaere, and later led by their son Chidi Ajaere, who spearheaded a reinvention of the business in 2010. The company transitioned to becoming a technology-driven mobility provider, expanding beyond bus services to include other services like GIG Logistics etc. GIG Mobility has also expanded its operations outside Nigeria, entering Ghana in 2019.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Marketing and Corporate Communication
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Create high quality marketing and communications content from concept through delivery that promote GIGM’s brand, Mission and Vision priorities
	Develop engaging multi-channel content to support impactful campaigns.
	Be an effective team player who will be in the weeds of priority projects to ensure successful activation through careful project planning, execution, and monitoring
	Establish best practices for marketing program execution, including defining project scopes, outlining deliverables, timelines, and execution efforts
	Collaborate with the Marketing and Communications team to identify new and promising opportunities to drive greater supporter engagement within propriety projects
	Devise and execute marketing campaigns to drive/improve quantifiable business metrics through innovative and pace-setting initiatives and ideas. These metrics include consumer demand (sales), customer satisfaction, brand strength
	Manage the administration of the company’s website and all social media pages, ensuring correctness and brand consistency of information thereon.
	Respond to inquiries and attend to press releases with management approval.
	Brainstorm and develop ideas for effective brand value enhancement.
	Work with other team members to develop, organise and manage company events, including KSS (Knowledge Sharing Session), TGIF (Thank God Its Friday), periodic employee bonding programs, CSR initiatives etc.
	Translate company business objectives into creative and executable corporate communications strategies and programs.
	Work with the Admin team to produce company-branded collaterals and corporate gift items, including identification and negotiation with relevant vendors, suppliers, stakeholders, and business partners.
	Demonstrate strong judgment in understanding key trends and news elements to develop a successful PR program with proactive and responsive media relations activities.
	Work with the Sales team to develop and implement marketing strategies and programs to promote the branding as well as products and services of the company.
	Maintain a rigorous and consistent approach to branding, messaging, content, quality, and general look and feel throughout communications and external messaging (touchpoints).


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with at least 7 years of experience.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@thegiggroupng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Job Openings at O.Peenice Adio Global Enterprise
content:
O.Peenice Adio Global Enterprise, based in Lagos, Nigeria, is a registered business specializing in thesales, supply, and distribution of general goods, general merchandise, and general contracting services. Registered with the Corporate Affairs Commission (CAC), the enterprise operates in areas such as manufacturing, warehousing, and sales executive roles.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Customer Service Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Manage large amounts of incoming phone calls
	Generate sales leads
	Identify and assess customers’ needs to achieve satisfaction
	Build sustainable relationships and trust with customer accounts through open and interactive communication
	Provide accurate, valid and complete information by using the right methods/tools
	Meet personal/customer service teamsales targets and call handling quotas
	Handle customer complaints, provide appropriate solutions and alternatives within the time limits; follow up to ensure resolution
	Keep records of customer interactions, process customer accounts and file documents
	Follow communication procedures, guidelines and policies
	Take the extra mile to engage customers.


Requirements and skills


	Proven customer support experience or experience as a Client Service Representative
	Track record of over-achieving quota
	Strong phone contact handling skills and active listening
	Familiarity with CRM systems and practices
	Customer orientation and ability to adapt/respond to different types of characters
	Excellent communication and presentation skills
	Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively.


Salary
N120,000 - N180,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 16th February, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hropeeniceglobent@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Contract Support Officer

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Prepare sales and purchase contracts
	Negotiate contract terms with internal and external business partners
	Review and update existing contracts
	Explain terms and conditions to managers and interested parties
	Ensure that employees understand and comply with company contracts
	Analyze potential risks involved with specific contract terms
	Stay up-to date with legislative changes and coordinate with the legal department as needed
	Ensure all deadlines and conditions described on contracts are met (e.g. payments and shippings)
	Maintain organized system of physical and digital records
	Create language standards for existing and new contracts


Requirements and skills


	BSc Degree in Business Administration; additional qualifications in law are a plus
	Proven work experience as a contract administrator,Contract Manager or relevant role
	Knowledge of legal requirements involved with contracts
	Familiarity with accounting procedures
	Excellent writing skills
	Keen attention to detail, with an ability to spot errors
	Strong analytical and organizational skills
	Ability to work with varying seniority levels, including staff, managers and external partners.


Salary
N100,000 - N200,000 / month.

Application Closing Date: 16th February, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hropeeniceglobent@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Sales Executive

Job Locations: Lagos & Kaduna
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Conduct market research to identify selling possibilities and evaluate customer needs.
	Actively seek out new sales opportunities through cold calling, networking and social media.
	Set up meetings with potential clients and listen to their wishes and concerns.
	Prepare and deliver appropriate presentations on products and services.
	Create frequent reviews and reports with sales and financial data.
	Ensure the availability of stock for sales and demonstrations.
	Participate on behalf of the company in exhibitions or conferences.
	Negotiate/close deals and handle complaints or objections.
	Collaborate with team members to achieve better results.
	Gather feedback from customers or prospects and share with internal teams.


Requirements and skills


	Proven experience as a Sales Executive or relevant role.
	Proficiency in English.
	Excellent knowledge of MS Office.
	Thorough understanding of marketing and negotiating techniques.
	Fast learner and passion for sales.
	Self-motivated with a results-driven approach.
	Aptitude in delivering attractive presentations.


Application Closing Date: 13th February, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hropeeniceglobent@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

     

    

        Click here to Apply
